business.headline: Cipla CEO Umang Vohra to exit in 2026; COO Achin Gupta named successorThe company said Achin Gupta, currently Cipla's Global Chief Operating Officer (COO), will take over as CEO and MD from April 1, 2026.

Novo Nordisk starts bidding war with Pfizer over US biotech MetseraNovo Nordisk bid up to $8.5 billion, including $6 billion upfront and later milestone payments. Pfizer's bid was worth $7.3 billion including milestones.
Sensex closes 593 points lower, Nifty below 25,900; RIL down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 592.67 points to close at 84,404.46, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 176.05 points to end at 25,877.85.

The sons in Tata Sons: A legacy forged in destiny by adoptionFor two centuries, the Tata name has symbolised Indian industry and philanthropy. But who exactly are Tata Sons? Who are the heirs to the empire founded by Jamsetji Tata? This is where the saga began.

Elon Musk's Starlink kicks off demo runs in Mumbai ahead of India launchDuring the trial, Starlink is expected to demonstrate how its technology can deliver fast and reliable internet, even in remote areas where traditional broadband services are often unavailable.

Groww IPO details out. Check price band, GMP, and important datesGroww IPO consists of a fresh issue of 10.60 crore shares worth Rs 1,060 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 55.72 crore shares amounting to Rs 5,572.30 crore.

Lenskart solutions IPO opens on October 31: Should you subscribe or wait?The much-awaited initial public offering (IPO) of Lenskart Solutions will open for subscription on October 31. As India's leading eyewear brand hits the primary market, investors are weighing if now is the right time to take a position.

End of big workforces? What Amazon's mass layoff really signalsAmazon's mass layoffs aren't about cutting costs; they signal a shift in how work is organised. AI is taking over tasks, but the real battle is about how companies value people.

Why India's IPO boom isn't always a sign of growth. Explains expertIndia's IPO market may be buzzing with record fundraising and investor enthusiasm, yet experts say much of the money raised isn't going into new projects or job creation.

UPS to cut 48,000 jobs this year amid major turnaround pushShares of the Atlanta-based delivery giant rose more than 7% in afternoon trading on Tuesday after it reported better-than-expected earnings and revenue.

ITR deadline for audit cases extended till December 10. Who benefits and what nextTaxpayers requiring audit reports have got more time this year — the CBDT has extended the ITR filing due date to December 10, 2025.

Russian oil taps turned off. What it means for Indian refinersIndia's cheap Russian oil phase is fading as sanctions tighten. Refiners are shifting to costlier US and Middle Eastern grades, raising import costs and likely putting eventual pressure on fuel prices.

Sensex, Nifty fall despite US Fed rate cut; all eyes on Trump-Xi meetingThe S&P BSE Sensex declined 251.52 points to 84,745.61 at 9:23 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 81.55 points to 25,972.35. Broader market indices also edged lower in early trade, tracking a mix of caution and profit booking.

This Sebi proposal may benefit your mutual fund investmentIn its consultation paper released on Tuesday, Sebi said the goal is to ensure that investors benefit more directly from the growing size of India's mutual fund industry. Sebi has invited public comments on the proposal until November 17.

Gold, silver rate today: Has US Fed rate cut impacted precious metal prices?Spot gold was up 0.4% at $3,942.97 per ounce. However, US gold futures for December delivery slipped 1.1% to $3,955 per ounce, indicating some profit booking after the recent gains.

US Fed rate cut by 25 bps: How will it impact Sensex, Nifty today?According to early trends, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 26,188 points as of 7:45 am, suggesting that the Nifty 50 may open above Wednesday's closing level of 26,053.9.

Gold and silver prices recover from recent lows. Is it time to buy?After slipping to three-week lows earlier this week, gold and silver have regained some shine ahead of the US Fed's policy decision. As markets anticipate a possible rate cut, traders are now weighing whether this rebound marks a good buying opportunity.

Nvidia makes history, becomes first company to reach USD 5 trillion market valueThe milestone, reached just three months after Nvidia crossed USD 4 trillion, now surpasses the entire cryptocurrency market's value and equals nearly half of Europe's benchmark Stoxx 600 index.

Significant progress made in India-EU trade talks: Piyush Goyal after key meetsThe minister said that both sides are working towards a fair and reputable trade agreement, which will benefit businesses and consumers in India and the EU alike.

boAt's parent Imagine Marketing refiles for Rs 15-billion IPO after 2022 delayTwo years after postponing its IPO plans, boAt's parent company Imagine Marketing is back in the game, filing fresh documents for a Rs 15-billion public issue.

entertainment.headline: Manav Kaul: I do less work because I love acting so much - Exclusive Manav Kaul is all set to star in the upcoming film, 'Baramulla', which will soon premiere in the streaming space. Kaul opened up to India Today in a candid conversation.

Actor Bhasha Sumbli on acting's emotional toll: A part of you stays behind In an exclusive conversation with India Today, actor Bhasha Sumbli spoke about portraying strong emotional roles on screen. The actor stated how such roles takes a toll on one's mental being.

Bigg Boss 19 Episode 68: Pranit More leads captaincy task In the latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19', the captaincy task continued between Malti, Pranit, Shehbaz, and Gaurav. Given the support, Pranit led the task.

Rashmika Mandanna shares special video message amid Thamma success. Watch Actor Rashmika Mandanna shared a special video message amid 'Thamma' sucess and thanked her team for their continous support. The film released in theatres on October 21.

Gauahar Khan shares adorable new photo of son Farwaan. Seen yet? Actor Gauahar Khan has shared a new picture of her newborn son, Farwaan, two months after his birth. The announcement comes as Khan balances her return to work, fitness, and family life.

Zubeen Garg's final film 'Roi Roi Binale' sets record with early Assam shows Late singer-actor Zubeen Garg's final film 'Roi Roi Binale' is set to release on October 31, and theatres across Assam and several cities across India are preparing for a grand celebration right from dawn.

Rajamouli on Baahubali's re-release: Your love brought Mahishmati back SS Rajamouli recently visited Prasad Cinema in Hyderabad for the special screening of 'Baahubali: The Epic'. During the event, the director thanked the audience for their love.

Stranger Things 5 trailer: Millie Bobby Brown faces monsters in deadliest battle The trailer for 'Stranger Things Season 5' was recently released. The final season witnesses Eleven and Mike leading their team in fight against monsters.

Sweta Keswani: Priyanka Chopra only helping herself, not elevating South Asians In an exclusive interview with India Today, actor Sweta Keswani discussed how Priyanka Chopra is not helping elevate South Asians. She said that the global icon is only helping herself.

Enrique Iglesias waves from car window at star-struck fan amid Mumbai traffic Spanish singer and songwriter Enrique Iglesias waved at and acknowledged a fan amid Mumbai traffic. He is currently in India for his Mumbai concert.

Zubeen Garg's handwritten note goes viral before final film Roi Roi Binale release Singer Zubeen Garg's handwritten note has gone viral before the release of his final film 'Roi Roi Binale'. The beloved actor-singer had written the touching note before he left for Singapore.

Akshay Kumar celebrates niece Simar Bhatia's debut in Sriram Raghavan's Ikkis Actor Akshay Kumar publicly expressed pride for his niece Simar Bhatia as she debuted in the film 'Ikkis', directed by Sriram Raghavan, extending his wishes to the cast and crew.

SRK on whether he'll work in film with Aryan: If he can afford me and my tantrums Shah Rukh Khan opened up on being directed by his son Aryan Khan during his live session on X. A social media user asked the actor whether he would be seen in a full-fledged movie directed by Aryan.

Can Mass Jathara reignite Ravi Teja's spark as Telugu cinema's people's hero? Once celebrated as Telugu cinema's unstoppable mass hero, Ravi Teja now stands at a crossroads. After a streak of underwhelming films, 'Mass Jathara' isn't just another release — it's a make-or-break moment to see if the actor who built his legacy on energy and relatability can reclaim his spark.

EXO's OT9 comeback? CBX accepts all conditions of SM Entertainment EXO's CBX trio signals readiness to reunite for full-group activities after months of silence. The ongoing legal disputes with SM Entertainment continue to cloud the possibility of a complete comeback.

Shah Rukh Khan fan asks for room at Mannat. Read the superstar's witty reply Shah Rukh Khan gave a witty reply to a fan asking for room in Mannat. The actor replied to the fan's question during his live interactive session on X.

BB19 producer denies minimum guarantee for contestants, breaks down casting process In an exclusive interaction with India Today, 'Bigg Boss 19' producer Rishi Negi cleared the air about the minimum guarantee contracts for the contestants. The producer even spoke about the casting process.

Sadhguru asks why handsome Yash is playing Ravana in Ranbir Kapoor's Ramayana Spiritual leader Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev expressed surprise over actor Yash being cast as Ravana in 'Ramayana'. The discussion highlighted casting challenges and differing views on the villain portrayal.

Bharti Singh wants baby girl, dreams of dressing her up like Deepika-Ranveer's Dua Bharti Singh, who is expecting her second child, said she wishes for a baby girl and hopes to dress her up like Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh's daughter Dua. The comedian shared her excitement after seeing her baby's colour sonography, calling the little one "so, so gorgeous."

general news.headline: Jemimah Rodrigues special fires India into final, ends Australia's golden runWomen's World Cup, IND vs AUS: India stormed their way into their third final in the history of the tournament after taking down seven-time champions, Australia, by five wickets on Thursday. Jemimah Rodrigues lit up the Navi Mumbai venue with a stupendous 127-run knock.

Children held hostage, cops barge in, man shot: Tense 3-hour standoff in Powai studioOver four tense hours, a supposed film audition in Mumbai's Powai turned into a minute-by-minute hostage crisis, from the moment Rohit Arya locked 17 children inside RA Studio at noon to the final police rescue at 4.30 pm that ended with his death.

US shocks with sudden work permit rule change, sparks outrageThe Trump administration has abruptly ended automatic EAD renewals for certain migrants, effective October 30. Immigration experts warn the move will hit Indian H‑1B holders' spouses and OPT students hardest, and might cause job losses due to 7–10 month processing time. Businesses relying on skilled workers might also face disruption as fresh vetting is now mandatory.

Vague, exaggerated: Maharashtra government on Mumbai hostage-taker's dues claimRohit Arya, who accused the state of denying him credit for his "Majhi Shala, Sundar Shala" concept, held 19 people hostage in Mumbai's Powai on Thursday before being shot dead by police after firing at officers.

You sold a dream; how can you stop us? Indian-origin woman confronts JD VanceThe US Vice President was also asked by the woman about his Hindu wife and their 'inter-cultural' household in the face of the Trump administration's strict immigration policies.

Justice Surya Kant appointed 53rd Chief Justice of India, to take charge on Nov 24The appointment was announced by Union Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal, who congratulated him on X. Justice Kant, a former Chief Justice of the Himachal Pradesh High Court, is known for his judgments on governance, social justice, and constitutional law.

35 minutes, 8 commandos: Inside Mumbai's dramatic studio hostage rescueThe operation was carried out in just 35 minutes. A Quick Reaction Team (QRT) of eight commandos barged into the audition room through a bathroom, a small entry point chosen to preserve surprise and prevent hostages from being exposed at the main entrance.

JD Vance hopes wife Usha, a Hindu, will eventually embrace ChristianityIt was wife Usha Vance, a Hindu, who helped an agnostic JD Vance, now the US Vice-President, find Christian faith. JD Vance has now said that he hopes Usha, who accompanies him to church most Sundays, would, eventually, see the Christian gospel like he does.

Watch: Jemimah Rodrigues breaks down in tears after steering India to finalJemimah Rodrigues broke down in tears after helping India reach the final of the Women's World Cup 2025 after beating Australia.

Prashant Kishor's party worker shot dead while campaigning in BiharAccording to police, Dularchand Yadav was first shot in the leg before being run over by a vehicle. Baadh ADPO Abhishek Singh said the police were "probing all angles" and that action would be taken on every complaint received.

Unpaid dues, credit denied: What triggered Rohit Arya's Mumbai hostage dramaRohit Arya, who held children hostage in Mumbai's Powai, was reportedly frustrated over unpaid dues and denial of credit for his school project. The activist's long-standing dispute with Maharashtra education officials allegedly pushed him to the desperate act that ended in his death.

US changes work-permit rules overnight; students, spouses of H-1B holders to be hitThe Trump Administration has ended automatic extensions of certain Employment Authorisation Documents (EADs) from October 30, affecting H-4 visa holders, F-1 students on OPT, and asylum seekers. Applicants must now undergo fresh vetting to get their work permit renewed. The overnight change disproportionately impacts Indian workers.

Blood, pile of corpses from Sudan massacre visible from spaceA humanitarian crisis has been unfolding in Sudan that the world has shut its eyes to. Such is the scale of the killings in El Fasher city in North Darfur captured from by militia Rapid Support Forces that the blood and the pile of bodies are visible from space.

3 trials, over Rs 1 crore bill, zero rain. The cost of cloud seedingDelhi rain: The Delhi government, in collaboration with IIT Kanpur, has conducted three cloud seeding trials to date, with none producing any significant rain in the capital. Is spending crores for just a drizzle worth it?

Who was Rohit Arya, man who held children hostage in Mumbai's Powai studio?Rohit Arya, the man who held children hostage in a studio in Powai, died of a bullet injury after being shot during a stand-off with cops at Powai studio.

US drones, not India, real reason why Pak-Afghan peace talks crashedPakistan Defence Minister Khwaja Asif blamed India after the peace talks with Taliban-ruled Afghanistan failed. Though Islamabad might use that as the ruse, the real reason behind the crashing of the talks, which were initiated after a recent war got hundreds killed, is Pakistan's helplessness at preventing US drones from attacks inside Afghanistan.

Zubeen Garg's final film 'Roi Roi Binale' sets record with early Assam showsLate singer-actor Zubeen Garg's final film 'Roi Roi Binale' is set to release on October 31, and theatres across Assam and several cities across India are preparing for a grand celebration right from dawn.

Two coffins of hostages on their way to Israeli troops amid tenuous ceasefireThe IDF further warned that Hamas was required to uphold the (ceasefire) agreement and take the necessary steps to return all the deceased hostages.

The sons in Tata Sons: A legacy forged in destiny by adoptionFor two centuries, the Tata name has symbolised Indian industry and philanthropy. But who exactly are Tata Sons? Who are the heirs to the empire founded by Jamsetji Tata? This is where the saga began.

Cried everyday: Jemimah, World Cup semis hero, reveals mental health battleJemimah Rodrigues opened up on her mental struggles after her scintillating knock that helped India beat Australia and reach the final of the Women's World Cup 2025. Jemimah completed an incredible turnaround after being dropped earlier on in the tournament.

Is it an alien ship? Interstellar comet lighting up our Solar SystemAs the third known interstellar object in history, 3I/ATLAS has astronomers and the internet on edge. Is it just a comet from another star system, or something stranger, as Harvard's Avi Loeb hints?

Video: Bengaluru couple chases delivery agent for brushing against car, kills himInitially registered as an accident, the case turned into a murder probe when CCTV footage showed the car deliberately following and hitting the victims. The couple has been taken into custody.

BJP asks poll body to act against Rahul Gandhi over 'PM will dance' remarkMissing in action for weeks amid speculation of a discord with Mahagathandhan allies, Rahul Gandhi kicked off his campaign in Bihar on Wednesday with a barrage of personal attacks targeting PM Modi.

Nirmala Sitharaman's Bhutan-bound flight makes emergency landing in SiliguriUnion Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's flight to Bhutan made an emergency landing in Siliguri due to severe bad weather. She will stay overnight in Siliguri and continue her journey on Friday once conditions improve.

sports.headline: India's Miracle Chase! Women Maul Aussies In Record Run To Enter World Cup Final This special report covers the Indian women's cricket team's sensational victory over seven-time champions Australia to enter the World Cup final, focusing on key players Jemima Rodrigues and captain Harmanpreet Kaur. Rajdeep Sardesai called the performance, 'truly one of the great chases in world cricket'. In a stunning display, India achieved the highest-ever run chase in women's ODI history, successfully gunning down a mammoth target of 340. The victory was built on an unbeaten 127 by Jemima Rodrigues and a crucial 89 from Harmanpreet Kaur. The program features in-depth analysis from cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar and India Today's consulting editor Rajdeep Sardesai, breaking down the turning points of the match and what this win means for Indian cricket. India will now face South Africa in the final on Sunday.

Rohit, Gambhir join celebrations after India stun Australia in World Cup semis Rohit Sharma, Gautam Gambhir and Sachin Tendulkar joined in on the celebrations as India defeated Australia to reach the final of the Women's World Cup 2025. India secured a record chase to set up the win in Navi Mumbai.

7-Months Pregnant, Delhi Cop Lifts 145kg To Win National Bronze This special report features the inspiring story of Delhi Police Constable Sonika Yadav, who won a bronze medal at the All India Police Weightlifting event in Andhra Pradesh while seven months pregnant. Sonika, who lifted a combined weight of 145 kilograms, said, 'I don't want pregnancy to be taken as a setback or something that stops women from doing something. It is normal and I wanted to set an example'. Serving in the force since 2014, she carefully balanced her rigorous training with medical supervision, with the full support of her family and the Delhi Police. Her remarkable achievement has sparked conversations about the possibilities for pregnant women in professional sports and has made her a symbol of strength and resilience, proving that motherhood and ambition can go hand in hand.

Credit to Jemimah: Harman proud after Rodrigues special ends Australia's reign Harmanpreet Kaur lauded Jemimah Rodrigues after the Indian batter scored 127 runs and helped India beat Australia by five wickets on Thursday to book their berth in the final where they will face Australia.

We are all crying with you: India doffs hat to Jemimah after World Cup special Jemimah Rodrigues scripted a fairytale comeback, smashing an unbeaten 127 to lead India to a record chase against Australia and seal a place in the Women's World Cup final. Fans and cricketers flooded social media hailing her match-winning heroics.

Cried everyday: Jemimah, World Cup semis hero, reveals mental health battle Jemimah Rodrigues opened up on her mental struggles after her scintillating knock that helped India beat Australia and reach the final of the Women's World Cup 2025. Jemimah completed an incredible turnaround after being dropped earlier on in the tournament.

Watch: Jemimah Rodrigues breaks down in tears after steering India to final Jemimah Rodrigues broke down in tears after helping India reach the final of the Women's World Cup 2025 after beating Australia.

Jemimah Rodrigues silences critics at home as India script world-record chase Women's World Cup 2025: Jemimah Rodrigues stepped up on the biggest stage, hitting her maiden World Cup hundred. Dropped two games ago, the Mumbai batter hit an unbeaten 127 that ended Australia's 15-match winning run in the 50-over tournament.

Jemimah Rodrigues special fires India into final, ends Australia's golden run Women's World Cup, IND vs AUS: India stormed their way into their third final in the history of the tournament after taking down seven-time champions, Australia, by five wickets on Thursday. Jemimah Rodrigues lit up the Navi Mumbai venue with a stupendous 127-run knock.

Hylo Open: Kiran George stuns World No.13 Popov, Lakshya and Rakhsitha advances Kiran George advanced to the quarterfinals of the Hylo Open Super 500 after overcoming a game deficit and a late decider challenge against World No.13 Toma Junior Popov. The victory marks a significant result for the Indian, with compatriots Lakshya Sen and Rakshitha Ramesh also progressing in their respective singles events.

Chirpy Rishabh Pant back: India A captain shines on comeback in Bengaluru India A vs South Africa A: Rishabh Pant returned to competitive cricket, leading India A against South Africa A in Bengaluru. His energetic performance and sharp wicketkeeping signalled a strong comeback after injury.

Jemimah Rodrigues lit up the Navi Mumbai venue with a stupendous 127-run knock.

The victory marks a significant result for the Indian, with compatriots Lakshya Sen and Rakshitha Ramesh also progressing in their respective singles events.

Chirpy Rishabh Pant back: India A captain shines on comeback in Bengaluru India A vs South Africa A: Rishabh Pant returned to competitive cricket, leading India A against South Africa A in Bengaluru. His energetic performance and sharp wicketkeeping signalled a strong comeback after injury.

India vs Australia, 2nd T20I Predicted XI: Will Arshdeep Singh get snubbed again?After a rain-hit opener in Canberra, India head to Melbourne with questions still swirling around team selection. Will Arshdeep Singh finally get his chance as India weigh spin-heavy balance against Australian firepower?

Nitish won't be Hardik replacement as India haven't given chances: ChopraAakash Chopra feels that Nitish Kumar Reddy won't be the ready replacement for Hardik Pandya as the all-rounder hasn't been handled well according to the former cricketer. Nitish has suffered an injury, which means he won't play the first three T20Is against Australia.

Watch: Smriti Mandhana in disbelief after unlucky dismissal vs Australia in semisWomen's World Cup, IND vs AUS: Smriti Mandhana scored 24 runs in the semi-final against Australia before Kim Garth took her wicket in the final over of the powerplay.

Martinez returns to Manchester United 1st team training after lengthy layoffLisandro Martinez has resumed full first-team training with Manchester United after recovering from a serious ACL injury suffered in February. The defender took part in a first-team session at Carrington, marking his first appearance since his surgery eight months ago.

Tanush Kotian credits Mumbai's experienced stars for improved showing for India ATanush Kotian reflects on his growth as an off-spinner through guidance from senior players and coaches, following a strong bowling display against South Africa A.

Shafali Verma's dramatic ODI comeback ends in heartbreak against AustraliaWomen's World Cup, IND vs AUS: Shafali Verma managed just 10 runs off five balls in the semi-final before being dismissed LBW by Kim Garth. The match marked Shafali's ODI comeback after a year out of the squad.

Rahul Dravid recalls mother's reaction to viral Indiranagar ka gunda advertisementRahul Dravid opened up about his viral 'Indiranagar ka gunda' advertisement and initial doubts. Dravid's bat-wielding, road-rage persona became a huge hit and the ad went viral on social media in 2021.

Litchfield hundred powers Australia to highest World Cup semi-final scoreAustralia posted the highest score in Women's World Cup semi-finals history on the back of Phoebe Litchfield's stunning hundred on Thursday, October 30. Australia posted 338 runs in 49.5 overs against India.

Bengaluru FC coach questions Khalid Jamil on using Sunil Chhetri as a lone strikerBengaluru FC head coach Gerard Zaragoza criticised India's use of Sunil Chhetri after the team's Asian Cup exit, raising concerns about his positioning and effectiveness.

Mumbai Indians rubbish rumours of Rohit Sharma's move to Kolkata Knight RidersMumbai Indians have dismissed rumours of Rohit Sharma's trade to Kolkata Knight Riders ahead of IPL 2026. The franchise quipped on X that such a move is "not just difficult, but impossible," reaffirming their faith in the five-time title-winning star.

Rohit Sharma deserves credit for changing India's white-ball mindset: Rahul DravidFormer India coach Rahul Dravid has credited Rohit Sharma for changing the way the national team started playing white-ball cricket. Dravid and Rohit masterminded India's T20 World Cup 2024 win.

Beta version of Travis Head: Phoebe Litchfield stuns India fans with century in semisPhoebe Litchfield's dazzling Women's World Cup semi-final century mirrored Travis Head's 2023 final heroics, as both Aussies delivered the stupendous knocks with flair and precision on cricket's grandest stage.

PKL Season 12 final: Dabang Delhi vs Puneri Paltan all you need to knowDabang Delhi K.C. and Puneri Paltan will face each other in the PKL Season 12 final at the Thyagaraj Indoor Stadium, New Delhi. Both teams have displayed dominance throughout the league and each of their three meetings this season have gone into a tiebreaker.

Mitchell Starc arrives in Navi Mumbai to support Alyssa Healy for AUS vs IND semi-finalMitchell Starc's presence in the stands wasn't enough to inspire wife Alyssa Healy, who fell for just 5 in Australia's semi-final clash against India. The Aussie skipper's early dismissal gave India a strong start.

IPL 2026: Abhishek Nayar becomes new Kolkata Knight Riders head coachKolkata Knight Riders have confirmed that Abhishek Nayar has been appointed as the new head coach of the franchise ahead of the IPL 2026 season.

Suryakumar Yadav is India's best option at number 3 vs Australia: Robin UthappaRobin Uthappa believes Suryakumar Yadav should bat at No. 3 in India's T20I lineup to regain form and stability. The former India batter feels consistency in position will unlock his true potential.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
